channel.title: Comments on: Prepare For Fewer Cache Hits As Chrome Partitions Their HTTP Cache

item.title: By: josephscott
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2019/10/16/prepare-for-fewer-cache-hits-as-chrome-partitions-their-http-cache/#comment-192464">Benjamin Bryan</a>.
Benjamin - even more this I think people would commonly over estimate cache hits across sites, with this, it seals the deal.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Benjamin Bryan.

Benjamin – even more this I think people would commonly over estimate cache hits across sites, with this, it seals the deal.

item.title: By: Benjamin Bryan
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Bryan
item.description: This is good to know, I have been moving more resources to load locally when possible to get a patter PageSpeed score but was wondering if it was doing more harm than good since common resources would have to be reloaded. Turns out it may be that way soon anyway.
item.content:encoded: This is good to know, I have been moving more resources to load locally when possible to get a patter PageSpeed score but was wondering if it was doing more harm than good since common resources would have to be reloaded. Turns out it may be that way soon anyway.

item.title: By: josephscott
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Monirul Islam Monir - I'd recommend serving them from the site domain as your site.
item.content:encoded: Monirul Islam Monir – I’d recommend serving them from the site domain as your site.

item.title: By: Colin McDermott
item.dc:creator: Colin McDermott
item.description: Locally hosting my web fonts and then getting them working w/ http/2 push via Litespeed had a big impact when I was optimising my site.
item.content:encoded: Locally hosting my web fonts and then getting them working w/ http/2 push via Litespeed had a big impact when I was optimising my site.

item.title: By: Monirul Islam Monir
item.dc:creator: Monirul Islam Monir
item.description: So now what's the best option for font optimization?
item.content:encoded: So now what’s the best option for font optimization?
